quotes: Before the UN Special Mission to Guinea-Bissau in April 1972, the Portuguese colonial authorities had denied requests for study visits
In 1971 the PAIGC extended an invitation to the UN Special Mission to visit the areas of Guinea-Bissau under its control.
From 2 to 8 April 1972, the UN Special Mission, comprising representatives from Ecuador, Sweden and Tunisia, visited the liberated areas of Guinea-Bissau under the control of the PAIGC.
Soon afterwards, in September 1973, the National Assembly of Guinea-Bissau declared its independence and over 70 UN member states afforded the country diplomatic recognition.
